docs.lead_paragraph: Cholera infantum, the fatal scourge of children under three years of age, is not likely to cut as large a figure as usual in the total number of deaths in the city for the current year. Of this much Dr. Roger S. Tracy already feels sure, though the actual statistics are not yet separated from the mass of death certificates to show the comparative improvement of infantile health over the results of last year.

headline.main: THE HEALTH OF THE CITY; But for the Grip in the Spring the Death Totals Would Be Low. FEWER VICTIMS OF CHOLERA INFANTUM Dr. Tracy Confident There Will Never Be Another Cholera Scare -- Typhoid Fever and Diphtheria.
